author: Staff Reporter
text:
An unidentified body that was buried two years ago in Mettur was exhumed and samples taken for DNA analysis here on Friday.

On January 25, 2014, Vinod (15), son of Babu Varghees-Mary of Chintadripet in Chennai, went missing. Ms. Mary lodged a complaint with the Chintadripet police and a case was registered.

But search efforts failed to locate him. In December 2014, Ms. Mary filed a habeas corpus petition in the Madras High Court.

The court ordered the police to locate the boy and produce him in the court.

Inquiries pointed out that a boy drowned in the Cauvery river in Mettur on March 29, 2014. Since his identity could not be established, the police buried the body in Mettur.

The police filed a petition in the Madras High Court that ordered for exhuming the body and identifying it.

The Chintadripet police approached Mettur Tahsildar Krishnan for the process. A team of doctors exhumed the body and took samples. A DNA sample test would reveal whether the missing boy is the same one the police are looking far.

The samples were taken to the Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital in Salem on Saturday.

15-year-old boy went missing from Chintadripet two years ago and search efforts failed
title: Body of Chennai resident exhumed
